fields.summary: JIRA Importers Plugin Tutorial has a broken link
Issue Security Scheme continues affecting some issues despite having been removed from project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33439].
  {panel}

As per [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=264045011] we need to have the setting 'READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON' while configuring MS-SQL database server with JIRA.

However, in our documentation we do not mention that anywhere. Please update the following documentation : 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2005
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008
fields.summary: Update JIRA MS-SQL documentation to specify READ_COMMITTED_SNAPSHOT ON setting
2nd version
HTML enabled email responses to tickets with embeddable images
Whitespace between fields in "Details" section of "View" screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33426].
  {panel}

It would be a great feature to have a link to the Events page:

https://hostedpa.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ListEventTypes.jspa

In the Edit notification page:

https://hostedpa.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditNotifications!default.jspa?lin&schemeId=10000

Since these two things are actually connected but one (notifications) is under Issues and one (events) is under System - that link would be very helpful to immediately see the connection.

!manage_events.png!
fields.summary: Add a link to the events page on the Edit Notifications page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33425].
  {panel}

Most Java development tools (like Eclipse or IntelliJ IDEA) are able to download source code when needed, for debugging or developing.

Still, because Atlassian limits the access to the Jira source code, the automatic source code download fails, requiring people to login to Atlassian download source and  manually configure the links to the source code in your IDE. 

This makes the development process harder while it does not add any benefits to Atlassian. 

If someone really wants to get Jira without paying, they will always find ways to get the source code. The current limitation is just hurting normal customers.
fields.summary: Jira source code should be downloadable via standard ways (maven) - not limited
Create a notification scheme documentation should mention something about custom events

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33422].
  {panel}

User specified project key will be reset back to system's suggested if the form failed with non-exist user for Project Lead.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Open up create new project dialog.
# Fill in *Name* field (system will suggest a project key at this point).
# Change project key to something different.
# Specify an invalid username for project lead.
# Click *Submit* and it should failed with {{The user you have specified as project lead does not exist}}.
** Project key will be changed back to system's suggested previously instead of keeping what user has specified.

User will most probably creates the project as soon after correcting project lead field without realizing the key has been reverted. User will need to delete and repeat the same process again.
fields.summary: User specified project key will be reset back to system's suggested
Sorting by component field seems to group by project
Make Support Zip Files Downloadable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33417].
  {panel}

It's not clear what the User Property option is in JIRA.  We can add a key and value to a user, but what does this do?

The documentation doesn't really clarify what this feature is:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Managing+Users#ManagingUsers-Addingapropertytoauser

Can we get some explanation on this?
fields.summary: Clarify User Property Documentation

fields.description:
I need to set custom priority options per project. Instead of using the default: Major, Trivial, etc, we need to use numbers 0,1,2,3,4

I tried the solution provided in this issue, JRA-3821, but is not working:
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3821

I still see all the values for the field Priority: default values + the ones I added 1 -4
fields.summary: configure custom priority options per project
REST docs specify incorrect status code for valid response
As a JIRA admin, when copying an existing workflow, I'd like to immediately edit the name so i don't have to then go search for it
Allow to select more than one group when editing user groups of one user.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33406].
  {panel}

Currently the "Supported Platofrms" documentation for JIRA 4.4 states for Postgres database : 
 bq. PostgreSQL 8.2 and later with PostgreSQL Driver 8.4.x.
This is not correct as we clearly do not support Postgres 9 with JIRA 4.4. Please change this section to  : 
bq. PostgreSQL 8.2, 8.3, 8.4 with PostgreSQL Driver 8.4.x
fields.summary: Change the database section for "Supported Platforms" page on JIRA 4.4 documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33399].
  {panel}

Hi,

I've created a Chrome extension for that, but it would be better if it were a default feature of JIRA so I wouldn't have to tweak all of Atlassian's JIRA instances.

Basically, from the fixVersion, it would be nice to reach the Manage Versions, because when you're about to enter the version you've just released, you're always missing the right version. See attached screenshot, a few people already told me they thought it was a default feature of JIRA ;)

Cheers,
Adrien
fields.summary: Reach Manage Versions from the Issue view
Display Parent's Summary with Sub-Task's Summary in Issue Filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33394].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of Bug

When using the Wiki Style Renderer, there are times when the spacing between the bullets are not shown correctly. 

h3. Steps to replicate

# In the comment or description of an issue, enter the following (as an example) :
{noformat}
* *test*
** one
** two
* *test two*
** one
** two
{noformat}
# The preview of it would show the following :
!preview.png|thumbnail!
# However, when inserted into JIRA, the result would be the following :
!result.png|thumbnail!

h3. Additional Info

* Everything seems to show fine if there is an empty space placed in between the two main points, like the following :
{noformat}
* *test*
** one
** two

* *test two*
** one
** two
{noformat}

* Behavior is also different if the main points (test and test two) is not *bold* - Here is the preview :
!without bold preview.png|thumbnail!
and here is the result :
!without bold result.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Wiki Style Renderer does not show bullets spacing correctly
Enable Mail Handler to automatically reply emails to closed issue
Any string in the square brackets will be rendered as hyperlinks using Wiki Style Renderer
Allow access to the contents of .rar archive from JIRA issue
The "24x24" avatar URL in the REST API's "user" resource links to a 16x16 image

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33378].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behavior:
If a field is set to 'Required' in the *Field Configuration*, it will always be prompted in any screen in any issue that uses this Field Configuration and does not have any value for the field. Even if the field is not set in any screen in JIRA.

h3. Desired Behavior:
JIRA cleans up these configurations. If a field is not present in any screens, JIRA will automatically make the field optional. 

h3. Alternative Behavior:
JIRA will disregard the 'Required' setting of the *Field Configuration* if the field is not present on the screen. This way, even though the field is required for the screens it is in, JIRA will not prompt a value for the field when it is not possible to add one. This would also help in some cases of JRA-5783, where users would only add the field to one screen.
fields.summary: Better Behavior for Required Fields
Workflow Plugin Summary View
Add an on/off switch (or checkbox) on the create and edit issue screen
Remove the word 'Users' from the 'Global Permissions' groups column
SHARE: Every addressee should be mentioned in the notification.

Found while QA'ing JRA-21043.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Change the link colour to bright green
2. Visit the Dashboard

expected: links inside gadgets should be green
actual: links are still blue

If you add a new gadget it gets the correctly coloured link. This indicates that the markup for gadgets is cached and isn't being destroyed when the L&F changes are made.

I got an issue that I am not sure why it is happening.

After I have created a new project to be accessible by an individual Client, some how I got some of the existing tickets missing. Nobody has removed the ticket ( at least I could not see anywhere the ticket was removed.). This is the message when I try to open the ticket:
Permission Violation

If it helps, this is the direct URL of the ticket:
https://infobahn.jira.com/browse/LDG-1753

I got a few other tickets missing...
Can you help me on finding the reason/solution for the missing ticket?

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Create a new custom field select list.
# Configure the select list and add more than 15 options to the select list field. Please see the screenshot below:
!17_options.JPG|thumbnail!
# When search using the following JQL query:{noformat}test = {noformat} It show only 15 items, please see 
!15_items_show.JPG|thumbnail!

*Finding*
* Tested in JIRA 4.4.x, 5.0.x, 5.2.x and 6.
* There is limitation searching projects as well.

*Suggested Improvement:*
* It would be great that JIRA have the ability to limit how many items are shown in Issue Navigator screen.
fields.summary: JQL function should show more than 15 options in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33361].
  {panel}

Hi
When I go to a Project Summary in Jira 5.2.10, the reports are not sorted correctly. In our previous version of Jira (5.0.7) the reports appeared in a drop down menu, but not sorted too. I was looking for some configuration option to allow report sorting but I can't find it.

It would be woderfull if we could grant permission to certain roles to get access to this reports, or any section, issue screen (fields visibility without using Behaviours plugin), etcetera. 

Thank you
Best regards
fields.summary: Project Reports not sorted correctly
Export the entitymodel.xml when XML backup data is generated

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33357].
  {panel}

_Steps to Reproduce_

* Create an issue {{TESTONE-1}} and include the comment "foo" inside the issue for the first comment:
!bug_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* Navigating to the *Advanced Search*, using the following parameter should not display the issue {{TESTONE-1}}:
{code}
comment !~ "foo"
{code}
!bug_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* However, navigating back to the issue page, try to add the second comment "bar" into the issue:
!bug_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* This issue is reproducible using the same parameter in the *Advanced Search* JQL whereby you can see that {{TESTONE-1}} is displayed, ignoring the original condition of the JQL:
!bug_4.JPG|thumbnail!

*Workaround*

* Create a filter such as {code}comment~foo{code}, which will return all the foo comments. Save it as {{foo comments}}
* Create a new filter as {code}filter!= "foo comments"{code}. This will exclude all issues from the previous filter and the desired results will be returned.
fields.summary: JQL parameter "!~" not working properly for comment field
Upgrade to latest JIRA Suite Utilities

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33352].
  {panel}

Currently administrators are able to review the last login of users via the users administration screen.

An improvement would be to allow a report to be generated on this data from the UI.  This would be beneficial for customers, specifically OnDemand customers who are unable to access the database.

Some previously requested items are:
* Users not accessing the system > _n_ months
* All users in _x_ group
* Users who have accessed between _dd/mm/yyyy_ and _dd/mm/yyyy_
* Users with application access and remaining licenses
fields.summary: Reporting of user activity within UI
Activity Stream Assignment Events
Workflow Page - Anchors Not Working
Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics should have option to consolidate values
As a USER, I would like the Create button on the Create Issue Modal to load the new issue.
Mail Handler should better handle messages that are rejected due to recipent not matching catch mail list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33342].
  {panel}

h3. Justification of this Improvement Request
Customer mentions that the performance of his JIRA is currently very slow, whereby his users mention to him that whenever they login it would need to load up all the dashboard in their desired state in a very long time.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# login
# Open any project 
!1.jpg!
# select the Issues tab row (not to confuse with the Issues button at the top)
!2.jpg!
# Then it would show the project overview with Issue statistics data
# Select a different project (from the recent projects list)
# Now it would show the issue statistics page of another project
# Log out from the current user
# Log in
# Select projects button (to open the last selected project)
*Current behavior*: It would show the *Summary tab* in the project overview page
*Requested behavior*: It should show the default state, the previously selected Issues tab which is the *issue statistic data* page.
fields.summary: default state in project overview
Provide an Administrative Preview of updated Screens
Associate DVCS commits to JIRA issues by inserting the hash into JIRA
JIRA Pie Chart Gadget Doesn't Display For Anonymous Users
Improve the average age report documentation
Allow modification of maximum results on a filter subscription
Filter Results only send the first 200 results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33332].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
Browse to the _Notification Helper_ in _Adminstration_ and try to check for an issue which is a sub-task.

*Expected Results:*
The _Notification Helper_ should show me results after adding an issue to check if the user will get notifications

*Actual Results:*
After typing the issue, you get the error that the issue does not exist.

*Workaround*

Browse to the issue, and then use the Notification Helper from the view issue screen.
fields.summary: Notification Helper does not work with sub-task

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33328].
  {panel}

_Steps to Reproduce_
* Create a custom field (Eg. Severity) and make sure that it is applied *ONLY* to *Bug* issue type
* Create a few issues with the *Bug* issue type
* Add the column in the *Issue Navigator* and confirm that it appears on the search for Issue Type *Bug*
!issue_navigator_1.JPG|thumbnail!
!issue_navigator_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* However, searching for *All* Issue Types does not render the *Severity* column:
!issue_navigator_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* Exporting the view to Excel can be deceiving as the value of the custom field is lost comparing the following screenshot(s)
** _All Issue Type_
!excel_1.JPG|thumbnail!
** _Bug Issue Type_
!excel_2.JPG|thumbnail!

Maybe there can be some sort of improvement to this? At least to give the user to *fully* export the view to include all the fields regardless of the Issue Type or if there are any other approach to this?
fields.summary: Custom Field is not being exported to Excel if Custom Field does not apply to all Issue Types in Issue Navigator
Upgrade JIRA Timesheet Reports and Gadgets Plugin to latest version 2.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33323].
  {panel}

h5. Summary
Prior to JIRA 6, the UI includes a drop-down list of uncategorised projects, as per the screenshot:

!5.2.11.png!

But in JIRA 6.0 and above, the list is not available anymore. That said, it does not shows all uncategorised projects as easily as before. Adding the feature back would be great.

!6.0.1.png!
fields.summary: Add the Uncategorised Projects list in the Edit Project Roles page
Inheritance of project configurations
Bigger avatar image in user profile page

fields.summary: An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: -------

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33318].
  {panel}

I've been thinking about this one for a while and I think it would be a good one.

I know you can create your own workflow with your own status in Jira, however, I bet everyone is always interested in knowing what tasks are blocked or impeded by an obstacle... specially one group in particular, care to guess?, yes: Management

Management (under the Theory Z at least http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theory_Z) should always help developers/employees with obstacles, which can be things such as: awaiting customer/user response, fuzzy requirements, etc.

Having this in the default Jira workflow would improve the user experience and make Jira more useful. 

Rally is an issue tracking system that has a blocked state built in, and users do take advantage of it.
fields.summary: Add a blocked/impeded status to the default Jira workflow

fields.description:
Issue was first reported by one of our users; able to log in with Firefox, but cannot navigate to an issue, either by searching, clicking on a link, or any other method.  The ID appears in the URL and in the title of the tab, but whatever is initially on the page (have tried it from the dashboard, and from a blank tab) never changes, and the "loading..." icon next to the title of the tab never resolves. IE8 is working fine, so it's browser-specific.  Updated FF, and that did not affect the behavior.  Ran an integrity check on JIRA and there were no issues.

If you need any logs or other diagnostics, please let me know what you need.
fields.summary: Issues not loading in FireFox
Provide an "Undo" feature for when a user transitions an issue by mistake
Add admin feature to change Status field to any or previous value
Option to copy the "Issues in Epic" when cloning an Epic
Cloned Epic is not bringing the Issues in Epic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33311].
  {panel}

The items from the following plugins were removed from the workflow:

Transition: Reopen

System post functions removed from this transition:
 - Update Issue Field

Transition: Reopen

System post functions removed from this transition:
 - Update Issue Field
fields.summary: Workflow Export loses basic post functions, conditions and validators
ChangeLogUtils.createChangeGroup deprecated API alternative relies on deprecated issue GVs
Restrict Groups to be Synchronized to Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33300].
  {panel}

Make it possible, to define the default value for a custom field in a field configuration.
Now there is only the possibility to set the default value global.

i'd like to have the option, to define a value in context with the project and issuetype - the field "summary" has many different meanings - for example in bugs or new issues.

so we could use the default value as a kind of "templates" - this would be a powerful feature.
fields.summary: Enable Default Values for CF per FieldConfig
Figure out what we're going to do with Configured (Base) URL vs Detected URL
Display the disable date and user for the outgoing mail setting
Add a log entry when outgoing mail has been enabled / disabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33292].
  {panel}

As discovered in a customer issue:

Subsets of users will see slow performance. Others have everything working just fine. This slowdown happens across all pages within JIRA. The instance has a large number of projects. Users facing slowdown only have access to a small subset of projects. The names of the projects they have access to, are towards the end of the alphabet.

JIRA will complete a permission check when there is a single success. This check is currently performed per project in an alphabetical order. If there is a large number of projects, and the user only has permission to the ones at the end of the alphabet, they will experience slowdown at every permission check (every page).

h3.Workaround
The workaround is to create a bogus project called "A" and add users to the permission scheme here.
fields.summary: Improve performance for checking user permissions with large number of projects
Create issue "create" button dissappears on resize

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33288].
  {panel}

Not sure in which project I should create this bug. 

atlas-create-jira-plugin
A new plugin structure is required for JIRA 5 plugins due to significant changes in the APIs.
Create a plugin for?
1) JIRA 5
2) JIRA 4 (or earlier)
2

fields.summary: Can not generate plugin for JIRA 4
Add a 'Back' button to the create project dialog
Add Comment if shared
Disable RSS on Activity Stream
Add mobile friendly favicon to jira mobile ui
Fix documentation on JIRA REST API Example

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33271].
  {panel}

Currently the [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options] page lists the following for External User Management:

{quote}
When turned ON, you will no longer be able to create, edit or delete users/groups from within JIRA (or via email or import); but you can still assign users/groups to project roles, and create/edit/delete user properties. Additionally, JIRA will not display options for users to change their password, or edit their profile.
Generally you would only turn this ON if you are managing all your users from outside JIRA (e.g. using Crowd, Microsoft Active Directory or another LDAP directory).
Default: OFF
{quote}

However through the GUI we can see that this has changed (when editing those settings):

{quote}
Indicates that you are using user management from outside JIRA. JIRA will not display options for users to change their password, or edit their profile.
Note: With the 'authentication only' LDAP provider, this should be left off, as accounts are stored locally.
{quote}

As of JRA-27280 this functionality has changed, as from [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-27280?focusedCommentId=334737&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-334737].

Can you please update the following pages to reflect this:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA050/Configuring+JIRA+Options
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA051/Configuring+JIRA+Options
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA052/Configuring+JIRA+Options
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options

Thanks!
fields.summary: Update Configuring JIRA Options docs for External User Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33268].
  {panel}

When attempting to Sync a GitHub respository with the DVCS connector the following stacktrace was seen:
{noformat}
com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:MySQL
	- version:5.5.29-0ubuntu1
	- minor version:5
	- major version:5
Driver:
	- name:MySQL Connector Java
	- version:mysql-connector-java-5.1.25 ( Revision: ${bzr.revision-id} )

com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.EntityManagedActiveObjects.create(EntityManagedActiveObjects.java:105)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.osgi.DelegatingActiveObjects.create(DelegatingActiveObjects.java:61)
...
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'MESSAGE' at row 1
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4185)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.checkErrorPacket(MysqlIO.java:4119)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sendCommand(MysqlIO.java:2570)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlIO.sqlQueryDirect(MysqlIO.java:2731)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionImpl.execSQL(ConnectionImpl.java:2815)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeInternal(PreparedStatement.java:2155)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2458)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2375)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.PreparedStatement.executeUpdate(PreparedStatement.java:2359)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:105)
{noformat}
* Strict Mode did not do anything as well.  
* Ultimately changing the datatype to 'LONGTEXT' solved this issue. 


{panel:title=Workaround| borderStyle=dashed| borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#a7c4e2 | bgColor=#E7F4FA}
The problem here was that the length of the message in the repository was beyond what the datatype "text" could receive (64k), so making this bigger solved the issue.
{code}
ALTER TABLE 'AO_E8B6CC_CHANGESET_MAPPING' MODIFY MESSAGE LONGTEXT;
{code}


{panel}

Can we make this error more descriptive or possibly output the value that is too long in the logs, or even the frontend for the customer to easily understand?
fields.summary: DVCS Data Truncation Error Should be More Descriptive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33263].
  {panel}

It will be great if we can allow end users to create issues by importing from csv/excel or other mechanism. Currently in JIRA, the Importers Plugin is available for administrators only. 

h5. Here are current situation for this feature:
* As we can see that you must Log in to JIRA as a user with the JIRA Administrators global permission. 
* The import tool is located under {{Administration > System > Import & Export > External System Import > Import}}, you only can access this page by login as administrator 
* During the importing, user can 'Create New Project' in your JIRA. It will be difficult for you to organize your system if any user can create projects.

h5. What we can change:
* Make the Importer plugin as a accessible feature on the JIRA UI for end users.
* During the importing, restrict end user on the Project Permissions level to be able/not able to 'Create New Project' in JIRA
fields.summary: Allow end users to create issues by importing from CSV or other importers
Restrict Post Functions to Sensible Timings

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33255].
  {panel}

Currently users have to go through a fairly laborious set of steps as per [Running JIRA over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS] to configure JIRA. If we were able to automate the creation of a JKS and generation of a CSR it would make this job a whole lot easier.

Can you please add a feature to the JIRA Config Tool that would:

# Create a new JKS and provide a CSR.
# Prompt the user to have it signed.
# Let the user enter the cert and provide the CA certs.
# Configure Tomcat to use that keystore and enable SSL.

Step 4 already exists, it would just need to be hooked into step 1-3.

If we can also handle conversion of certificates that would be ideal. For example, a user can import a PEM public cert and a PKCS12 private key into a PrivateKeyEntry that would be awesome. Maybe we could even put in some checks to ensure the cert chain is complete? I'm not entirely sure about how limitations here,.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Enhance the JIRA Config Tool to automate SSL Generation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33252].
  {panel}

While the user is on View Issue page of the parent issue, changing the subtask's order causes a full page refresh.

Problems: If the user is in the details view mode and changes the order of the subtask, then the user is taken to full page view issue mode and the search context is lost.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the Details view mode of the issue navigator, change the order of a subtask, by clicking on the up/down arrow next to the subtask
fields.summary: Changing Subtask order does a full page refresh, hence user loses search context.
Incoming and Outgoing mail server pages have misplaced buttons

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-33247].
  {panel}

Setup requires more than one user that has the same email address. 
One user has access to the issue and one user does not belong to a group that has permission to an issue. 
Must have an incoming email handler setup to add comments to an issue via an email reply. 
Notification event occurs on issue assignment
Create an issue and assign to user 1 (the one who has permission to the issue)
User 1 receives an email
User 1 replies to the email
Comment not logged because it is interpreted to be associated with user 2

There isn't a requirement that email addresses be unique.  May need to either evaluate any user that meets the email address, update the documentation to be clear, or not evaluate permissions. 

Minor issue.
fields.summary: Comments via email do not work correctly when more than one user has the same email
There's a bunch of junk in my email notifications
Static Resources in plugins is poorly documented.
